articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Iranian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Iranian President
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greeting to Mahmoud Ahmadinejad, president of Iran, Tuesday on the 33rd anniversary of the victorious Islamic Revolution in Iran.
					 Kim in the message said the Iranian people have gained many achievements in their efforts to defend the sovereignty of the country and the dignity of the nation and achieve peace, stability and development of the region.
					
					 Expressing belief that the favorably developing bilateral relations of friendship and cooperation would steadily grow stronger despite the complicated international situation, the message wished the Iranian president greater success in his work for building a powerful Iran.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Greets Iranian First Vice-President
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Greets Iranian First Vice-President
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- Choe Yong Rim, premier of the DPRK, Tuesday sent a message of greeting to Mohammad-Reza Rahimi, first vice-president of Iran, on the 33rd anniversary of its victory in Islamic revolution.
					 The message wished the people of Iran fresh progress and prosperity, expressing belief that the excellent friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would further develop in all fields including the politics, economy and culture.
					
					 On the same day Pak Ui Chun, foreign minister of the DPRK, sent a similar message to his Iranian counterpart Ali Akbar Salehi.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Inspects Pukchang Thermal Power Complex
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Inspects Pukchang Thermal Power Complex
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim acquainted himself with the electricity production at the Pukchang Thermal Power Complex, the nation's giant power base, on the spot on Thursday.
					 He looked round various places of the complex whose workers are waging a dynamic drive to improve the technical management of the generating equipment and maximize its efficiency in order to implement the instructions of General Secretary Kim Jong Il, the decision of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, the joint calls of the Central Committee and the Central Military Commission of the WPK and the militant tasks set forth in the joint New Year editorial.
					
					 He called a consultative meeting of officials concerned on the spot. 
					
					 The meeting underscored the importance to increase the production of pulverized coal, improve the coal quality supervision and fully meet the requirements of technical regulations and standard operation methods in the operation of equipment and technical management in the efforts to devotedly implement the instructions of Kim Jong Il for keeping electricity production going at a high rate.
					
					 It also took measures to ensure that the relevant units including the Cabinet increase social concern in the field of coal industry with positive help, minutely organize transport and command in order to realize intensive transport of coal from coal mines and plan the supply of materials and fuel oil necessary for maintenance of generators and operation of vehicles.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Inspects Pyongyang Thermal Power Complex
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Inspects Pyongyang Thermal Power Complex
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim toured the Pyongyang Thermal Power Complex to review its generation of electricity and operation of boilers and turbine generators.
					 He toured several places alive with the drive for increased electricity production true to the decision of the Political Bureau of the Workers' Party of Korea Central Committee, joint calls of the WPK Central Committee and Central Military Commission and the join New Year editorial and held a consultative meeting of officials concerned.
					
					 Discussed there were technical matters of setting up reasonable electricity production and supply plan, strictly controlling electricity consumption, adjusting power supply system.
					
					 He also pressed for normal operation of the power station, provision of raw and other materials needed for their repair and timely delivery of supplies from relevant institutions.

articles.title: Floral Basket from Vietnamese Ambassador
articles.content:
Floral Basket from Vietnamese Ambassador
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a floral basket and congratulatory letter from the Vietnamese ambassador to the DPRK on the occasion of the 70th birth anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 They were handed to an official concerned by Le Quang Ba, Vietnamese ambassador to the DPRK, on Friday.

articles.title: Sports Contest for Paektusan Prize Opens
articles.content:
Sports Contest for Paektusan Prize Opens
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- A sports contest for Paektusan Prize opened on the birth anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il. 
					 Its participants will compete in 10 events including basketball, volleyball, table tennis, handball, shooting, skiing and ice hockey in Pyongyang and Samjiyon.
					
					 Its opening ceremony was held at the Basketball Gymnasium in Chongchun Street Friday.
					
					Present were Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Choe Ryong Hae, secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea and others.
					
					 Pak Myong Chol, minister of Physical Culture and Sports, made an opening address.

articles.title: National Oratorical Contest Held
articles.content:
National Oratorical Contest Held
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- A national oratorical contest took place at the People's Palace of Culture Friday to commemorate the 70th birth anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 In an oratory titled "The great motto" Choe Myong Ju, department director of the Ministry of Food Procurement and Administration, impressively told the story that Kim Jong Il autographed a paper on supplying the people with fish on December 16 last year.
					
					  Pak Yong Sun, section chief of the Hoeyang County Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea in Kangwon Province, said in an excited tone that Kim Jong Il glorified his great life as a life that braved snowstorm.
					
					  In an oratory titled "Sun" Han Chong Su, vice-minister of Light Industry, praised Kim Jong Il as the great sun of mankind who recorded legends about  loving care for the people with rare leadership ability and noble virtue.
					
					 Speakers included Jong Myong Ok, manageress of Pyongyang Department Store No. 1, Kim Ju Song, department director of Railways, and Choe Myong Ok, deputy secretary of the Primary Committee of the WPK of Changwang Health Complex. In  their oratories made under the respective titled "Promise", "The General and his journeys to mix with people," "Road to the front and Changgwang Health Complex" they impressively said  there were too many stories to tell about Kim Jong Il's total dedication to the people.
					
					 Present there were Kim Ki Nam and Choe Thae Bok, officials concerned, officials of ministries and national institutions and officials in Pyongyang.

articles.title: Law on Registration of Foreign-funded Businesses Amended
articles.content:
Law on Registration of Foreign-funded Businesses Amended
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- The law on registration of foreign-funded businesses has been amended in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 According to a decree of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, dated December 21, Juche 100 (2011), the law consists of 34 articles in six chapters, dealing with the registration of businesses' founding, residence, taxation and customs.
					
					 Amendments were also made to the law on foreign-funded businesses and foreigners' tax payment and the law on insolvency of foreign-funded businesses.

articles.title: Agricultural Workers Meeting Held
articles.content:
Agricultural Workers Meeting Held
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- A meeting of agricultural workers took place in the plaza of the Party Founding Memorial Tower on Friday to pledge to accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un true to the behests of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 At the meeting a reporter and speakers said Kim Jong Il performed exploits before the country, the people, the era and history by developing and enriching the revolutionary idea of President Kim Il Sung and leading the Korean revolution along the path of victory.
					
					 The revolutionary exploits of Kim Jong Il would shine forever as he created the new history of perpetuating the memory of the President and turned the socialist country into a political, ideological and military power with his original Songun politics, they stressed.
					
					 They vowed to keep on the drive for the great and fresh victory of the Juche revolution.
					
					 A poem of pledge was read out there.
					
					 Earlier to it, an oath meeting of officials and members of the women's union was held at the Oun Revolutionary Site at outskirts of Pyongyang on Thursday.
					
					 Present at the meetings were Choe Ryong Hae, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.

articles.title: Migok Co-op Farm Wins in Socialist Emulation for 2011
articles.content:
Migok Co-op Farm Wins in Socialist Emulation for 2011
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- A socialist emulation drive among co-op farms now under way in the DPRK involve Migok in Sariwon of South Hwanghae Province, Sinam and Unhung in Ryongchon and Thaechon Counties of North Phyongan Province, Samjigang in Jaeryong County of South Hwanghae Province and Tongbong in Hamju County of South Hamgyong Province.   
					 These farms are glorifying their honor as the model farms in the Songun era. Their farmers increased grain and other agricultural production while sprucing up their villages.
					
					 Summing up the socialist emulation for Juche 100(2011), a testimonial and a rotating pennant of victory in the emulation were awarded to the Migok Co-op Farm in Sariwon in the name of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and the DPRK Cabinet.
					
					 An awarding ceremony of the pennant took place at the People's Palace of Culture on Thursday.
					
					 Present there were Choe Ryong Hae, secretary of the Central Committee of the WPK, and Ri Kyong Sik, minister of Agriculture.

articles.title: Many People Visit Kim Jong Il's Birthplace for 25 Yrs
articles.content:
Many People Visit Kim Jong Il's Birthplace for 25 Yrs
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- A total of more than 5,787,000 people of at least 3,500 organisations visited the birthplace of General Secretary Kim Jong Il in Paektusan Secret Camp since it was opened to public 25 years ago.
					 They included senior party, state and army officials, anti-Japanese revolutionary fighters, servicepersons of the People's Army, people from all walks of life, school youth and children, foreigners, overseas Koreans and south Koreans.
					
					 On Feb. 11, 1987 the visitors totaled more than 4,000.
					
					 The study tour has been unabated all the year round, typically the group of party information officials from across the country in February 1989, children's group to Jong Il Peak that August, single-minded unity group of youth in Ryanggang Province to Paektusan Secret Camp in February 1992.
					
					 The number of visitors to the birthplace is now on the steady increase in the run-up to the first Day of the Shining Star.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Efforts to Bring Kim Il Sung's Ideas, Desire into Reality
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Efforts to Bring Kim Il Sung's Ideas, Desire into Reality
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il published the famous work "The Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung Will Always Be with Us" on Feb. 11, Juche 85 (1996).
					 Kim Jong Il in the work stressed that President Kim Il Sung was a peerlessly great person the Korean people acclaimed for the first time in their history spanning thousands of years and the sun of humankind recognized by the whole world.
					
					 The work serves as guidelines for the Korean army and people in always venerating the President and carrying forward his ideas and cause.
					
					 All the Korean people keep in their memory the great feats performed by Kim Jong Il in the devoted effort for realizing the ideas and cause of the President.
					
					 He developed the Songun (military-first) idea of the President with a strong will to accomplish with arms the Korean revolution that was started and advanced triumphantly by dint of arms.
					
					 Thanks to the original Songun politics pursued by Kim Jong Il, the unity of the revolutionary ranks with the army as the mainstay has been strengthened remarkably, demonstrating the invincible might of the country.
					
					 Kim Jong Il worked day and night to bring into reality the desire of the President for the prosperity of the country.
					
					 He made long journeys to Jagang Province to kindle the flames of the Kanggye spirit and encouraged all the people to turn out in the effort for implementing the behests of the President.
					
					 He elucidated the idea and theory on the building of a socialist economic power in the new century and inspired the army to make a breakthrough in its building.
					
					 His wise leadership led to the appearance of modern production bases across the country and an overall technological updating of the national economy.
					
					 Encouraged by what the people of South Hamgyong Province have done, all other people in the country are now vigorously carrying on an industrial revolution in the new century.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Hails Kim Jong Il's Feats for Reunification
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Hails Kim Jong Il's Feats for Reunification
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il worked heart and soul for the country's reunification and national unity, says Rodong Sinmun Friday in a bylined article. Praising him as the great father and eternal sun of the nation who performed undying feats for them, the paper said: 
					 His overriding feat for national reunification was that he provided the June 15 era of reunification, new era in the national reunification movement, with his bright wisdom and outstanding leadership.
					
					 His far-reaching plan and outstanding leadership to carry out President Kim Il Sung's instructions for national reunification culminated in the historic Pyongyang summit on June 15, 2000 and the signing of north-south joint declaration whose basic spirit is "By our nation itself".
					
					 This spirit gave fresh momentum to the nationwide movement for independent reunification and helped the north-south relations make a fundamental switchover to those of reconciliation and unity from those of distrust and confrontation.
					
					 All-out north-south dialogue and cooperation were promoted after the publication of the June 15 joint declaration to be substantially conducive to national reconciliation, unity, peace and reunification.
					
					 The formation of All-Korean Committee for Implementation of June 15 Joint Declaration meant the creation of a parent body for alliance and solidarity for national reunification. The organization promoted nationwide drive for national reconciliation, unity and reunification involving the Koreans in the north and the south and abroad with differing idea, political view and ism.
					
					 The patriotic Koreans heartened by the declaration turned out to carry it out with willingness to dedicate their knowledge, strength and money.

articles.title: Minju Joson Calls Planned US-S. Korea Military Drills
articles.content:
Minju Joson Calls Planned US-S. Korea Military Drills
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- Key Resolve and Foal Eagle military exercises planned by the U.S. and the south Korean authorities this year are a rehearsal for war against the DPRK in view of their program and nature, says Minju Joson Friday in a bylined commentary.
					 The joint military drills used to screw up the tension on the Korean Peninsula every year, the paper said, adding:
					
					 This year's drills are pursuant to the U.S. new military strategy envisaging the drastic cut-down of military spending for a coming decade. Following its publication the south Korean authorities buckled down to "tightening alliance" with the U.S.
					
					 The U.S. is burdening south Korea with much more military backing under the pretext of "defense pact". This is aimed to use the south Korean puppet army as a shock brigade for igniting a war against the DPRK and minimize its own human and material losses.
					
					 An aim sought by the south Korean authorities is to lead military counteraction of the DPRK to an armed conflict and unleash a war under that pretext. Another aim is to escalate tension, deflect public attention, rally conservative forces under the pretext of "instable security" and win in upcoming April 11 "National Assembly" election.
					
					 This proves that the U.S. and its war servant Lee Myung Bak group of traitors are to blame for harassed peace and escalated tension on the Korean Peninsula, the stalled north-south relations and the looming danger of a war.

articles.title: New Name of GNP Censured in S. Korea: Minju Joson
articles.content:
New Name of GNP Censured in S. Korea: Minju Joson
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- The Emergency Measure Committee of the "Grand National Party" of south Korea announced  "Saenuri Party" as a new party name on Feb. 2, adding that the new party name will be finally decided at the national convention of party committees.
					 Minju Joson Friday says in a bylined article in this regard:
					
					 The GNP gentries are claiming that the new party name was selected from among contest entries, defying criticism from people.  
					
					 As known well, as soon as the contest entries on the new party name of the GNP were announced, people called it "a dirty party", "mad party" and so on. The GNP's homepages and notice boards were peppered with strange party names.
					
					At the prize contest for "renaming the GNP" held by the New Progressive Party, putting up "enveloped cash prize without money", "the party that sold off the country" emerged a winner.
					
					 Such derision and jeers have grown stronger since the announcement of the new name for the GNP.
					
					 Posted on internet homepages in succession are articles querying "Does this mean an intention to enjoy fresh power" and "GNP had better cease its efforts for increased power." Opposition parties ironically question "Is a new house having a new door plate only, leaving the house as it is." People from all walks of life are mocking at the "Saenuri Party" as "Bird beak party" and "Rag party", adding that "the nature of the GNP remains unchanged even after having a new name".
					
					 Members of the emergency measure committee opposed the replacement of the party name. Yu Sung Min, pro-Park leading member, said that "he could not accept the decision of the committee on changing the party name," adding "such important issue should be solved in line with the intention of members of the committee at the general assembly of the members".
					
					 One should wait and see if the proposed new party name will pass through the national convention of committees of the GNP. But what is clear is that the GNP behaved against people's mindset.

articles.title: S. Koreans Call for Implementing North-South Joint Declarations
articles.content:
S. Koreans Call for Implementing North-South Joint Declarations
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- A declaration released in a press interview in Taejon on Feb. 7 called for implementing the inter-Korean joint declarations to the letter. The participants included the permanent representative of the Jun. 15 and Oct. 4 People's Solidarity of south Korea, the chairman of the Family Movement for Realizing Democracy and co-representatives of the bodies comprising those who fell victim to all sorts of conspiratorial cases hatched by the authorities.
					 The declaration said the present era demands the punishment on the Lee Myung Bak regime and the conservative ruling party as they negated the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration, plunged the south-north ties to deadlock and deteriorated the livelihood of the people by resorting to unpopular rule.
					
					 It also called on the opposition camp to punish the Lee group without fail in the general election slated for in April by putting forward a sole candidate committed to carrying out the inter-Korean declarations.
					
					 It appealed to the progressive forces to get united to do their best for victory.

articles.title: S. Korea Toughens Suppression of Pro-Reunification Body
articles.content:
S. Korea Toughens Suppression of Pro-Reunification Body
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- The south Korean authorities on Feb. 8 cracked down upon the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification, a peace movement organization.
					 That day the intelligence service and prosecution forcibly searched the houses of four core members of the body including Secretary General O Hye Ran and the offices of the organization and its Inchon branch as well as the Jinbo Network Center in charge of the management of the organization's server.
					
					 The authorities charged them with the violation of the "Security Law". They made far-fetched assertions that the actions for the U.S. forces' withdrawal from south Korea, south Korea's breakup of the alliance with the U.S. and dissolution of the "UN Command" were conducted at the instructions of the north.
					
					 The suppression of the progressive body by the authorities is last-ditch efforts to dampen the ever-mounting spirit of the south Korean people for the reunification and tide over the ruling crisis.

articles.title: Members of Association of Victims of "NSL" Arrested
articles.content:
Members of Association of Victims of "NSL" Arrested
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- The south Korean fascist prosecution arrested members of the Association of Victims of the "Security Law" on charges of violation of the ill-famed SL. They were reported to have tried to set up an incense-burning altar to mourn the passing of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 It called for a non-governmental mourners group's visit to Pyongyang, overcome with sorrow over the untimely loss of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The organization in a statement denounced the authorities for their reckless actions to quell the mourning atmosphere of the people from all walks of life, discarding both ethics and morality, keen on escalating the confrontation with compatriots.
					
					 Holding that it is natural for the south Koreans to express deep condolences over the demise of Chairman of the National Defence Commission Kim Jong Il, it contended that it would set up all-people mourning incense-burning altar before the "Taehanmun" in Seoul.
					
					 Police turned out to block its action, asserting that other organization applied for holding an event in the same place and the like, but it opted to set up the altar.
					
					 The authorities hurled armed riot police and gangsters to mercilessly trample down upon the altar and forcibly remove it and arrested those involved in the action.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Presented Honorary Citizenship of Nigerian City
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Presented Honorary Citizenship of Nigerian City
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- Gusau City, Zamfara State, Nigeria presented the title of honorary citizenship to leader Kim Jong Il on his 70th birth anniversary.
					 A presentation ceremony took place at the city administration office building on February 3.
					
					 Present there were personages of the city administration and masses and members of the DPRK group for technical cooperation operational in the country.
					
					 Aliu Umar, administrative governor of the city, handed over the certificate to the head of the group.
					
					 The governor said Kim Jong Il was a great leader of not only the Korean people but also the progressive people around the world. Registering such a renowned man as an honorary citizen is a big event unprecedented in the city in its history and the biggest honor for the city government, he added.

articles.title: Officials of Korean Youth League in Japan Meets
articles.content:
Officials of Korean Youth League in Japan Meets
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- A pledge-taking meeting of officials of the Korean Youth League in Japan was held in Tokyo on Feb. 8 to carry through the behests of General Secretary Kim Jong Il and remain loyal to the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					 Present there were Nam Sung U, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, Kim Cha Dol, chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the Korean Youth League in Japan, officials of its Central Standing Committee and officials of the youth league in the Kanto area and of central organization and enterprises.
					
					 The participants laid a floral basket before the portrait of Kim Jong Il and made a bow.
					
					 A letter of pledge, which was read out at the meeting, said that they will bear deep in mind the faith that they are sure to win despite any violent storm as led by Kim Jong Un and stoutly prepare the youth league to be the rank remaining boundlessly loyal to his idea and leadership.
					
					 Meanwhile, an art performance "Cause of the Sun Shining Forever" was given by students of Joson University on the same day on the occasion of the birth anniversary of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Fact-Finding Group on Drafting of Koreans Meets
articles.content:
Fact-Finding Group on Drafting of Koreans Meets
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- A 2012 national consultative meeting of the Fact-Finding Group for the Probe into the Truth about the Forcible Drafting of Koreans took place in East and West Japan from Jan. 28 to Feb. 4.
					 Present there were those concerned of the civic organization active in the work related to the history and human rights issue of Koreans in different parts of Japan.
					
					 Reports on the activities conducted in 2011 were made by representatives from various parts of Japan which were followed by speeches.
					
					 Jin Kil Sang, vice-chairman of the Rights and Welfare Committee of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, referred to the fact that since the Fact-Finding Group was formed, it has conducted activities for solidarity with human rights, peace and friendship organizations of Japan in order to probe the truth behind the crimes committed by Japan and solve the human rights issue of the Koreans in Japan.
					
					 He accused Japan of still slapping sanctions upon the DPRK and persistently enforcing an undisguised policy of discrimination against the Koreans in Japan including the exclusion of the Korean schools from the tuition-waiver program for senior high schools, etc.
					
					  He noted that the group's future activities should provide an occasion of making a new advance in the history of the Koreans in Japan and their human rights issue and normalizing the relations between the DPRK and Japan, bringing earlier the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea and promoting friendship with Japan.
					
					  Hong Sang Jin, secretary general of the Central Headquarters of Koreans side to the fact-finding group, called for a more widespread movement for surveying remains of victims of the Japanese imperialists' forcible drafting and solving the human rights issue of the Koreans in Japan.
					
					 The meeting discussed and decided on an action program for this year which calls for publishing books "The history and human rights of Koreans in Japan" and "Records of the Fact-Finding Group for the Probe into the Truth about the Forcible Drafting of Koreans" and holding an inter-regional study, meeting, seminar, etc.

articles.title: Internet International Seminar Held
articles.content:
Internet International Seminar Held
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- An Internet international seminar took place from December 24 last year to January 31 this year under the co-sponsorship of the International Preparatory Committee for Commemorating the Centenary of Birth of President Kim Il Sung and the Korean Friendship Association to mark the 70th birth anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il, the 20th anniversary of his assumption of supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army and the 94th birth anniversary of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk.
					 The seminar on the theme of "The great leader Kim Jong Il will always be with us" was posted on the Internet homepage of the Korean Friendship Association divided into general chapter, mourning chapter, photo and music columns.
					
					 The general chapter carried papers praising the immortal life and exploits of Kim Jong Il and the mourning chapter had an article captioned "The great leader Kim Jong Il will always live in our hearts" illustrated with the portrait of smiling Kim Jong Il and photos and an article dealing with mourning atmosphere in the DPRK and various parts of the world.
					
					 The photo column carried photos showing the revolutionary activities of Kim Jong Il and the dear respected Kim Jong Un and the music column Korean songs including immortal famous masterpiece "O Korea, I Will Add Glory to Thee" and "Thunder over Jong Il Peak".
					
					 At the seminar Anders Kristensen, co-chairman of the Nordic Cooperation Committee for Friendship and Solidarity with the Korean People who doubles as co-chairman of the International preparatory committee, made a keynote report titled "Outstanding leader Kim Jong Il in the 21st century".
					
					 The report was followed by speeches made by personages in various circles of 17 countries including the secretary general of the International Liaison Committee for Reunification and Peace in Korea, the president of the France-Korea Friendship Association, the chairman of the Korean Friendship Association, the chairman of the Ukraine-DPRK Association, the chairman of the Sweden-Korea Friendship Association and the chairman of the Romanian Socialist Union who are co-chairpersons of the International preparatory committee.
					
					 The reporter and speakers praised Kim Jong Il who performed the immortal exploits before the country, nation, era and history by leading the Korean people, guided by the idea and intention of President Kim Il Sung, most prominent leader in the 20th century, as a peerlessly great man and outstanding politician.
					
					 They said that the Songun politics of Kim Jong Il serves as an event to be specially recorded in carrying out the human cause of independence, praising the Songun leadership exploits he performed by providing a sure military guarantee for the prosperity of the country and opened a great heyday for building a thriving socialist nation.
					
					 They went on:
					
					 The idea and cause of HE Kim Jong Il have been invariably carried forward and accomplished by supreme leader Kim Jong Un. The noble august name and benevolent image of HE Kim Jong Il will always be remembered by the Korean people and progressive people and his revolutionary idea and immortal exploits go down long in the history.
					
					 The speakers called on the progressive people the world over to positively contribute to the cause of immortalizing Kim Jong Il in various forms and methods.
					
					 While the seminar was under way more than 26.7943 million people surfed its Internet homepage.
					
					 In connection with the seminar Alejandro Cao de Benos, chairman of the KFA, sent a letter to Kim Jong Un on January 28.

articles.title: Appeal of North Side Committee Supported
articles.content:
Appeal of North Side Committee Supported
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- The European Regional Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification and the Society for Cooperation among Koreans in Germany issued a joint statement on Feb. 5 in support of an appeal of the North Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration addressed to all Koreans at home and abroad.
					 The appeal reflects the Koreans' desire for independence, peace and reunification to thwart by dint of the great national unity the plan of the warlike forces to plunge the Korean nation into a nuclear holocaust, the statement noted, adding: 
					
					 The Headquarters and the Society bitterly denounced anti-reunification forces for their daydream to maintain the sycophantic and traitorous regime while dampening the unanimous aspiration and will of all the compatriots for the independent and peaceful reunification by clinging to the coattails of outside forces.
					
					 The statement said all the Koreans would stand shoulder to shoulder with fresh confidence and optimism about victory and make active efforts to achieve the great national unity and the independent reunification.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il Remembered in China
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il Remembered in China
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- A remembrance meeting took place in China on Feb. 8 on the 70th birth anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 The participants laid floral baskets before the portraits of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il before paying tribute to them.
					
					 Speeches were made by the son of anti-Japanese revolutionary fighter in China Li Zade, Zhang Jinlu, a daughter of Chinese anti-Japanese revolutionary martyr Zhang Weihua, Zhou Wei, a daughter of Zhou Baozhong who is Chinese related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle, a daughter of Feng Zhongyun, a daughter of Zhang Shou-jian, and others.
					
					 They recalled the benevolent loving care shown by the President and Kim Jong Il for their families in their lifetime.
					
					 The dear respected Kim Jong Un took measures to help them visit Pyongyang after the demise of Kim Jong Il in December last year and express condolences before his bier, they said.
					
					 Kim Jong Il pursued Songun politics under the uplifted banner of the Juche idea by inheriting the idea and cause of the President and thus shattered the moves of the imperialists to stifle the DPRK and led the Korean people to victory, they added.
					
					 Kim Jong Il worked hard for the cause of building a thriving socialist nation and national reunification day and night till the last moments of his life and made every possible effort to boost the traditional Sino-DPRK friendship, they stressed.
					
					 They noted the President and Kim Jong Il were peerlessly great men who would go down long in history.
					
					  Present at the meeting were the DPRK ambassador to China and staff members of his embassy.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Printed in Peru
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Printed in Peru
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "The Historical Lesson in Building Socialism and the General Line of Our Party" was published in booklet by Grafica A.J. Hermanos Publishing House of Peru on Feb. 3.
					The work, published on January 3, Juche 81 (1992), clarifies the fact that a historic lesson drawn from socialist construction is to strengthen a driving force for revolution with faith in socialism and a correct guiding idea, adhere to the principles of socialism and strengthen the comradely unity and cooperation based on independence.
					
					 It also clarifies the thought that thoroughly carrying out the three revolutions, ideological, technical and cultural, while strengthening the people's power and steadily increasing its function and role is the general line of the Workers' Party of Korea for building socialism and its validity.

articles.title: Joint Meeting Held in Finland on Day of Shining Star
articles.content:
Joint Meeting Held in Finland on Day of Shining Star
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- A joint meeting took place in Finland to mark the birth anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il under the sponsorship of the Finnish Preparatory Committee to commemorate the 70th birth anniversary of Kim Jong Il on Feb. 3.
					  Displayed in the venue were books and photos showing his immortal Songun revolutionary leadership exploits and the Korean people's building of a thriving socialist nation. 
					
					 Figures of political parties and organizations, Juche idea followers and people of various strata were present at the meeting.
					
					 The participants placed bouquets before the portraits of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and paid tribute to them.
					
					 The chairman of the committee said in a speech that Kim Jong Il was highly praised as a great statesman, prominent thinker and theoretician and father of all people as he devoted all his life to the materialization of the idea of Kim Il Sung and the accomplishment of his cause.
					
					  The DPRK and its people successfully concluded the unprecedentedly Arduous March and created a great history of recording a new chapter for independent and peaceful reunification of Korea under his wise leadership.
					
					 Kim Jong Il's untimely passing was a great loss to the Finnish people, too.
					
					 The friends of Korea in Finland extend firm support and solidarity to the Korean people who overcame their sorrow over his passing with strength and courage and are hastening the building of a thriving socialist nation under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 A message to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the meeting.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Lauded by Benin Party Leader
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Lauded by Benin Party Leader
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was a defender of justice who made immortal contributions to Korean style socialism and human independence, holding aloft the banner of socialism and independence against imperialism.  Ali Houdou, president of the Socialist Party of Benin, said this in a statement on Feb. 3 on the birth anniversary of Kim Jong Il.
					  He honorably defended Korean style socialism, a precious legacy of President Kim Il Sung, by pursuing Songun politics and consolidated the DPRK to be a single-mindedly united political and ideological power and a socialist bulwark which no enemy dares attack despite the vicious offensive of the imperialist allied forces to stifle it and severe natural disasters, Ali Houdou noted, and continued:
					
					 Progressive humankind is looking up to socialist Korea as a beacon of hope and symbol of victory as it is fortunate to hold Kim Jong Il as an outstanding leader and wise teacher.
					
					 He will always be alive with progressive mankind including the Benin people.
					
					 Victory and glory will always be in store for the Korean people invariably advancing along the road of socialism under the leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea headed by the dear respected Kim Jong Un. -0-

articles.title: Projected US- S. Korea Joint Military Exercises under Fire
articles.content:
Projected US- S. Korea Joint Military Exercises under Fire
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy and the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea released a joint statement on Feb. 2 in denunciation of Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises.
					 The above-said saber-rattling is aimed at realizing their criminal scenario to invade the DPRK and bring down Korean style socialism centered on people and reflects the U.S. policy of aggression to dominate the Asian-Pacific Region, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 The planned war maneuvers will create again the danger of war on the Korean Peninsula and threaten the peace and security not only in Northeast Asia but in the Asian-Pacific Region and the rest of the world.
					
					 The statement called on the Juche idea, Songun idea followers to positively support and encourage the DPRK, a bulwark of socialism and the motherland of Juche and the just cause of the Korean people.
					
					 The British Branch of the Korean Friendship Association in a statement on Feb. 1 assailed the provocative Key Resolve and Foal Eagle. 
					
					 Chairman of the Japan Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea Fumihiro Himori in a statement on Feb.3 termed the above-said saber-rattling an operation for invading the DPRK from every angle and demanded halt to the exercises.
					
					 Meanwhile, the North American Institute for Study of the Juche and Songun Idea in the U.S. on Jan. 28 posted an article lashing out at the moves of the U.S. and south Korean authorities against the DPRK on the Internet Homepages of Songun group consisting of persons from various circles in different countries and regions.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star Commemorated by Cambodian Media
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star Commemorated by Cambodian Media
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- Cambodian media on Jan. 30 released special reports on the occasion of the birth anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il. 
					 Cambodian paper Kmae Amata carried a special write-up illustrated with a photo of President Kim Il Sung with leader Kim Jong Il, a photo of Kim Jong Il waving back to the cheering crowd on the tribune of honor of Kim Il Sung Square and a photo of Kim Jong Il with the dear respected Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 The article titled "Leader Kim Jong Il Will Be Immortal" said:
					
					 In the demise of Kim Jong Il the world lost the most prominent great man.
					
					 He was a master of leadership as he ushered in the greatest heyday of prosperity in the national history of Korea.
					
					 He was a kind-hearted father of the people who regarded the people's happiness as his biggest pleasure and conducted dynamic activities for it.
					
					 A Cambodian radio said:
					
					 He steadily developed in depth the Juche idea founded by Kim Il Sung through energetic ideological and theoretical activities.
					
					 He authored various works at a time when the world socialism was undergoing a trial due to the collapse of socialism in Eastern European countries, proving that socialism is the invariable ideal of humankind.
					
					  He developed Songun idea in depth and formulated Songun politics as a basic political mode under socialism, thus providing progressive mankind with a powerful ideological and theoretical weapon for making the socialist cause win one victory after another even under any hard circumstances and conditions.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Greatness Praised by British Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Greatness Praised by British Organization
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy praised the dear respected Kim Jong Un in an article posted on internet website on Jan. 21.
					 Praising Kim Jong Un as an incarnation of loving care for the people, the article said:
					
					 In December last year not only the people but the nature grieved over the greatest loss to the Korean nation.
					
					 The Koreans who were sobbing being shocked by the unexpected and untimely loss of the nation's father were again moved to tears at what Kim Jong Un had done for them.
					
					 He might have felt bigger pain than others but he looked into the supply of fish to the Pyongyang citizens, a matter which leader Kim Jong Il was concerned about even on Dec. 16, just the day before his death, as he was always greatly considerate of the diet of the citizens in the capital. 
					
					 Moved by Kim Jong Un's loving care for the people identical to Kim Jong Il, the citizens sobbed again.
					
					 Elaborating on how Kim Jong Un made the people's convenience a key priority during the mourning period, the article further said:
					
					 The legend-like stories produced during the mourning period are a clear reminder of Kim Jong Un's noble disposition of loving the people.
					
					 It is his maxim and view on life that even a star in the sky should be picked up and nothing should be spared for the people and that the officials should become servants for the people.
					
					 Kim Jong Un is a great sun that embraces the people and brings happy life to them.

articles.title: Chinese Ministry of Defense Rejects Accusations of Japanese Media
articles.content:
Chinese Ministry of Defense Rejects Accusations of Japanese Media
 Beijing, February 9 (KCNA) -- An official of the Publicity Department of the Chinese Ministry of Defense recently snubbed the accusations made by Japanese media.
					 Refuting the accusations made by Japanese media on Feb. 3 against a Chinese naval warship's passing through the waters between the Island of Okinawa and Miyako Island, he declared it is a routine work included in the yearly plan for a naval flotilla of the Chinese People's Liberation Army to conduct maneuvers in the Western Pacific Ocean in the first half of February.
					
					 China has a legitimate right to freely sail in the waters and this is in line with international law, he added.

articles.title: Russian Navy to Resume Ocean Patrol
articles.content:
Russian Navy to Resume Ocean Patrol
 Moscow, February 9 (KCNA) -- Vladimir Visotski, commander-in-chief of the Russian Navy, recently declared the Russian Navy would resume its world ocean patrol.
					 The state leadership attaches very great importance to the development of the navy, he noted, adding that the Russian Navy would restart uninterrupted combat patrol of strategic missile cruisers over the world ocean in June.

articles.title: Russian FM Slams Japan for "Day of Northern Territories"
articles.content:
Russian FM Slams Japan for "Day of Northern Territories
 Moscow, February 9 (KCNA) -- The Russian Foreign Ministry in a statement on February 7 chided an event held in Japan in commemoration of the "Day of Northern Territories."
					 The statement expressed its regret at the fact that Japan openly emphasized its stand of demanding "return" of Southern Kurils under the jurisdiction of the Russian Federation.
					
					 It stressed that meetings being held in Japan for the return of "northern territories" cannot be a good way for the bilateral relations.

articles.title: Russia Slams US and West Pressure on Its Election Bodies
articles.content:
Russia Slams US and West Pressure on Its Election Bodies
 Moscow, February 9 (KCNA) -- The chairman of the Russian Central Election Committee accused the U.S. and West of pressurizing its election organs.
					 The chairman condemned officials of those countries for criticizing the committee's internal procedures regarding the list of presidential candidates.  He called on the international community to fairly assess the outside pressure on Russia's election bodies which is aimed to pursue the political purpose rather than abidance by laws.

articles.title: Cuba Condemns Tightened US Blockade
articles.content:
Cuba Condemns Tightened US Blockade
 Havana, February 9 (KCNA) -- The U.S. economic, commercial and financial blockade against Cuba has now been in force for 50 years, and its harassment and siege mechanisms are being strengthened, the Cuban Foreign Ministry reported on Tuesday.
					 In an interview with the Prensa Latina news agency, Anayansi Rodriguez, head of Multilateral Affairs said, the U.S. blockade has been intensified under Obama's administration, especially in its extraterritorial characteristics, since this government encourages a higher persecution of Cuba's financial transactions anywhere in the world.
					
					 These sanctions were little short of genocide, she added.

articles.title: Cuba Rejects EU High Representative Statements
articles.content:
Cuba Rejects EU High Representative Statements
 Havana, February 9 (KCNA) -- Cuba on Tuesday rejected recent statements about the island expressed by the High Representative of the European Union (EU) for Foreign Affairs and Security Policy, Catherine Ashton, which the foreign ministry described as misguided.
					 Elio Rodriguez, acting director of the European department at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, stated that those comments formulated to the correspondent in Geneva of O Estado de Sao Paulo newspaper "constitute a new interference in Cuba's internal affairs."
					
					 He stated that Havana does not recognize that she has any moral or political authority to criticize the island on human rights matters.
					
					 "Let's urge the bloc to analyze the dangerous problems afflicting it, such as the crisis of the Euro, the anti-emigrant policy, violent repression against demonstrators, and the increasing social exclusion of the unemployed and low income sectors," Rodriguez stated in the text.

articles.title: WIDF Demands US Free Cuban Five
articles.content:
WIDF Demands US Free Cuban Five
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- The Women's International Democratic Federation (WIDF) sent a letter to the U.S. president demanding an immediate release of the five Cuban antiterrorist fighters who have been unjustly detained in U.S. prison for over 13 years.

articles.title: US Sanctions against Iran "Hostile Moves": Spokesman
articles.content:
US Sanctions against Iran "Hostile Moves": Spokesman
 Tehran, February 9 (KCNA) -- Iran's Foreign Ministry spokesman Ramin Mehmanparast said Tuesday that the U.S. sanctions against the Islamic Republic are "hostile moves."
					 Talking to reporters in his weekly press briefing, Mehmanparast said the sanctions that western countries and the United States are pursuing against Iran are not new subjects and they have been going on for the past 30 years.
					
					 U.S. President Barack Obama on Monday ordered the freezing of Iran's property under U.S. jurisdiction, including that of the country's central bank.
					
					 The Iranian spokesman said Tuesday that if the Americans and their allies want to stop the progress of the Islamic Republic and prevent it from achieving its rights "by resorting to illogical pressures and inhumane means, our nations will respond properly."

articles.title: Iran Makes Efforts to Develop Defence Industry
articles.content:
Iran Makes Efforts to Develop Defence Industry
 Tehran, February 9 (KCNA) -- Iran has achieved successes by making sustained big efforts to develop its defence industry.
					 A state-owned electronic, optical and online system was developed and nine production assembly lines went operational, said the minister of Defence and Armed Forces Logistics on Feb. 6.
					
					 Among them were assembly lines producing new-type laser guided system, guided system for anti-armor missile, alarm device for laser defence system, three new-type radars, strong microwave lamp, etc.
					
					 Meanwhile, four research projects were completed in the field of electronic warfare to enter into the phase of industrial production in the near future.

articles.title: Biting Cold and Heavy Snow Cause Rising Toll in Europe
articles.content:
Biting Cold and Heavy Snow Cause Rising Toll in Europe
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- The extreme cold and heavy snow are claiming increasing lives in Europe. 450 people were reported dead in Europe as of Feb. 8.
					 Six people were frozen to death in Poland on Feb. 7, bringing the toll due to the cold to 53 since Feb. 1.
					
					 Four people were reported dead due to the biting cold in Hungary on Feb. 1. 
					
					 A river flooded following heavy snow in Bulgaria, leaving 8 people dead and 2 people missing.
					
					 The water flew to the northern part of Greece, flooding the area and forcing the Greece government to put the area on alert.
					
					 Inclement weather persisted with heavy snow in Romania. This cut off electricity supply to 146 villages, isolating the area. 
					
					Georgia shut down all state-run schools.

articles.title: West Sanctions against Iran Prove Ineffective
articles.content:
West Sanctions against Iran Prove Ineffective
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- The U.S. and other Western countries' sanctions against Iran are proving ineffective.
					 Iran's oil deals with other countries are getting more brisk despite the U.S. ever-tightening sanctions. 
					
					 An Iranian government official concerned said 70 per cent of his country's oil export has gone to countries and regions of Asia even since the West's slapping sanctions against the country 40 per cent of which is held by China and India. 
					
					 Opposed to the West' sanctions against Iran, China has increased the volume of trade with Iran more than 50 per cent over the last two years, reaching 45 billion U.S. dollars. 
					
					 On Jan. 26 a spokesman for the Foreign Ministry of Pakistan observed that Pakistan clarified its support to the Iran-Pakistan gas pipeline project and reiterated this project is not subject to the above-said sanctions. He also clarified the stand to steadily push forward it. 
					
					 On Jan. 29 the minister of Finance of India formally clarified that his country would not join in the sanctions put by the U.S. and the EU on Iran.
					
					 Japan which claimed to be a staunch ally of the U.S. earnestly asked the U.S. to partially exclude it from the anti-Iran oil sanctions and allow it to continue settlement with the Central Bank of Iran. 
					
					 Economic exchange is getting more brisk between Iran and other Asian countries in various fields. 
					
					 Kuwait and the United Arab Emirates, etc. discussed the issue of boosting bilateral cooperation with Iran. 
					
					 Iraq, for example, signed agreements with Iran in road and railway construction and air transport, etc. It was reported that they included the issue of lifting the U.S. measure for limiting the flight by Iranian planes. 
					
					 Sergei Ryabkov, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs of Russia, noted on Jan. 26 nobody would make concession under the "whip of sanctions."
					
					 This will spark a new crisis rather than providing any solution. European colleagues of the six parties are going in the direction of escalating the sanctions against Iran without any idea. 
					
					 Iranian President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad said on Jan. 26 that it is more than three decades since the Central Bank of Iran severed its relations with the U.S. and, therefore, the sanctions have lost their practical value and these efforts are, in fact, futile.
					
					 He ridiculed the West, saying it would be a de-factor victim of its unilateral sanctions.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim se entera de estado de produccion electrica en Pukchang
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim se entera de estado de produccion electrica en Pukchang
Pyongyang, 10 de febrero (ACNC) -- El premier coreano Choe Yong Rim averiguo el dia 9 sobre el terreno el estado de produccion electrica del Complejo Termoelectrico de Pukchang que desempena un papel muy importante en la produccion de energia electrica del pais.
					Choe recorrio varios lugares del complejo donde los obreros y tecnicos que hacen bien la gestion tecnica de los equipos generadores y dinamizan la lucha por elevar al maximo su eficacia para cumplir el legado del Dirigente Kim Jong Il y las tareas combativas presentadas en la resolucion del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, las consignas conjuntas del CC y la Comision Militar Central del PTC y el editorial conjunto del Ano Nuevo.
					
					En el terreno el premier convoco una reunion de consulta de los funcionarios correspondientes.
					
					En la ocasion dio enfasis en que para materializar a costa de la vida el legado del Dirigente de normalizar en alto nivel la produccion de energia electrica, es necesario aumentar la produccion de carbon pulverizado, mejorar el control sobre la calidad de carbon y observar los reglamentos tecnicos y el modo estandar de manejo de equipos.
					
					Ademas, se adoptaron las medidas para que el Consejo de Ministros y otras unidades interesadas ayuden bien la rama de industria carbonifera elevando la atencion social sobre esta, organicen bien el transporte concentrado de carbon excavado en las minas y planifiquen y suministren suficientemente los materiales y combustibles necesarios a la reparacion de generadores y el funcionamiento de medios de transporte.

articles.title: Inaugurada Exposicion Central de Fotos por 16 de febrero
articles.content:
Inaugurada Exposicion Central de Fotos por 16 de febrero
Pyongyang, 10 de febrero (ACNC) -- Quedo inaugurada el dia 9 en el capitalino Palacio Cultural del Pueblo la Exposicion Central de Fotos por el 70o aniversario de natalicio del Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					Alli estaban exhibidas mas de 300 fotografias, inclusive las alusivas a la vida revolucionaria del Dirigente.
					
					Entre ellas figuran "El gran Dirigente, camarada Kim Jong Il proclamando el programa de transformacion de toda la sociedad segun la idea Juche", "El gran Dirigente, camarada Kim Jong Il y el estimado camarada Kim Jong Un dirigiendo el entrenamiento de fuego de la gran unidad combinada del Ejercito Popular de Corea" y "Kwangmyongsong no. 2 vuela manifestando plenamente el poderio estatal de la Corea del Songun".
					
					Ademas se ven "El Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un participa en la ceremonia de despedida junto con los funcionarios directivos de los organos del Partido, el Estado y las fuerzas armadas", "Plaza Kim Il Sung esta llena de llantos funebres por el fallecimiento de del Dirigente Kim Jong Il" y las otras alusivas a los dias del gran duelo nacional.

articles.title: Iniciada Exhibicion de Sellos de Corea
articles.content:
Iniciada Exhibicion de Sellos de Corea
Pyongyang, 10 de febrero (ACNC) -- Quedo inaugurada la Exposicion de Sellos de Corea por el 70o aniversario de natalicio del Dirigente           Kim Jong Il.
					En el lugar estan exhibidos el sello que lleva la imagen del Dirigente, emitido en 1987 por primera vez, y los otros por temas que demuestran las inmortales hazanas revolucionarias del Dirigente quien condujo a la victoria el partido, el ejercito y el pueblo.
					
					Ademas, se exponen diversos sellos de los filatelistas.
					
					La ceremonia inaugural tuvo lugar el dia 9 en la Exhibicion Permanente de Sellos Coreanos.
					
					Asistieron a la ocasion Kim Ki Nam, secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Sim Chol Ho, ministro de Comunicaciones, y otros funcionarios, creadores, filatelistas y trabajadores.
					
					Alli, fueron invitados los funcionarios encargados de cultura y de amistad de las embajadas de varios paises en Corea.
					
					Terminada la ceremonia, los participantes recorrieron los sellos exhibidos.

articles.title: Modificadas leyes vinculadas con empresas extranjeras
articles.content:
Modificadas leyes vinculadas con empresas extranjeras
Pyongyang, 10 de febrero (ACNC) -- Ha sido modificada la ley de registro de empresas inversionistas extranjeras de Corea.
					   Segun el decreto fechado 21 de diciembre del 100 (2011) de la Era Juche del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, la ley esta compuesta de 6 capitulos y 34 articulos que tratan el registro de fundacion y direccion, asuntos tributarios, aduana de las empresas de ese tipo, etc.
					
					   Y se enmendaron tambien las leyes sobre los impuestos para las empresas inversionistas extranjeras y los extranjeros y sobre la bancarrota de las primeras.

articles.title: Minju Joson denuncia ejercicios conjuntos militares anti-RPDC
articles.content:
Minju Joson denuncia ejercicios conjuntos militares anti-RPDC
Pyongyang, 10 de febrero (ACNC) -- En un comentario individual difundido este viernes, el periodico Minju Joson senala que los ejercicios conjuntos militares "Key Resolve" y "Foal Eagle" planeados este ano por Estados Unidos y las autoridades surcoreanas son las maniobras belicas tanto en su contenido como en el caracter para agredir militarmente a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					Cada vez que se libraban anualmente susodichos ejercicios, la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana se agudizaba extremadamente, comienza el comentario y continua:
					
					El simulacro de este ano se realizara segun la nueva estrategia militar de EE.UU. Tan pronto como publico el imperio la nueva estrategia militar con el contenido de reducir considerablemente durante 10 anos los gastos militares, las autoridades surcoreanas se aferran obstinadamente al "fortalecimiento de alianza" con EE.UU..
					
					A su vez, EE.UU. impone al Sur de Corea mucho gastos militares bajo el rotulo de la "promesa de defensa" con el maligno intento de provocar la guerra contra la RPDC utilizando a los titeres como brigadas de choque y disminuir al maximo sus perdidas humanas y materiales.
					
					El intento de las autoridades surcoreanas es inducir nuestra contramedida militar en el periodo de entrenamiento conjunto militar y pretextandola provocar el choque armado y, a la larga, desatar la guerra anti-RPDC.
					
					Ademas, persiguen desviar la vista de la opinion publica agravando la tension y realizar sin problemas las elecciones de diputados a la "Asamblea Nacional" que tendran lugar el 11 de abril uniendo las fuerzas conservadoras bajo el pretexto de la "preocupacion de la seguridad".
					
					Todos los hechos demuestran que el autor de perturbacion de la paz y de agravacion de la tension,  el responsable de la ruptura de las relaciones intercoreanas y el caudillo de la guerra es precisamente EE.UU. y la banda del traidor Lee Myung Bak,  lacayo del imperio y sirviente de la guerra.
